members.joinCircumstances: Enel conquered Skypiea and established himself as God
Serves as one of Enel's four priests

Commands the Divine Soldiers under Enel's authority

keyMoments.title: Enel Demonstrates Power Over His Army
keyMoments.description: Enel casually attacks his own priests with lightning out of boredom, demonstrating his overwhelming power and the fear-based hierarchy of God's Army.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the brutal nature of Enel's leadership and the power dynamic within his organization.

keyMoments.title: Priests Receive Unlimited Power
keyMoments.description: Enel removes all limitations on his priests, giving them free rein to hunt down the Straw Hats and Shandia with their full abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a major escalation in the conflict and shows Enel's willingness to unleash his forces without restraint.

keyMoments.title: Survival Game Declared
keyMoments.description: Enel announces a survival game where only five people will survive (himself and four others), setting God's Army against the Straw Hats and Shandia.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the framework for the climactic battles of the Skypiea Arc.

bases.description: God's Army operates from Upper Yard, the former sacred ground of Skypiea

jollyRoger.description: Not applicable - God's Army uses Enel's lightning symbol
